Key Match Events: Dereck Lively II finished with six points, five rebounds, one steal and one block, upstaging Victor Wembanyama in the first half.
Dallas Mavericks broke the game open with a 19-5 run in the fourth quarter.
Victor Wembanyama was held to 17 points, 9 rebounds, 1 assist, 0 steals, 1 block, and 4 turnovers in 31 minutes of play.
Pre-Game Insights: San Antonio Spurs coach Gregg Popovich benched Victor Wembanyama with 5:59 remaining in the game when the Mavericks held a 111-90 lead.
Post-Match Reflections: Victor Wembanyama struggled with the Mavericks' physical defense, taking eight shots from deep but failing to thrive inside.
The Mavericks' defense made it difficult for Wembanyama to get to his spots and crowded him whenever possible.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Daniel Gafford, P.J. Washington, Dereck Lively II and even Klay Thompson tested Wembanyama's more muscled frame.
Victor Wembanyama reportedly added 25 pounds of muscle leading into the 2024-25 campaign.
